text: Not at the moment, but we have been looking into tools that could help us replace the "Optimisation" tab inside the classic email editor with something more useful. Shared your feedback with the team to look into :+1:

<@U24DCSJBE> other info you could give is a suggestion to use alt text and background colors(though the person building the template likely has more sway over background colors. (the reason is because people using screen readers can’t read text in images, it’s better in the email client’s eyes(ranks less as spam) also for those with email clients that hide images at first, it makes the email more useful right off the bat.)
Good point, Jon. We've been reworking some of this validation lately, I'll make sure we address this.

Using the email client testing function for the first time in a while, props to the team for adding so many options, but would there be any way to maybe group them by client now instead of device/browser/OS? I would think something like a 'Gmail' dropdown with tick boxes would be a lot cleaner than the current experience.
Fair point, Mark, the list is a little unwieldy. I'll see what we can do :+1:
Idea: Can we get a description field for the blog tags? This way we can use that as a meta description for the blog topic pages
also, for the "Meetings" pages that HS creates, it needs a canonical link and a meta description
I was just tasked with having to look into a bunch of SEMRush and Moz errors that are popping up in reports
lots have to do with the canonicals lol
in other news though, i fixed them using that `is_listing_view` with an if
I think HS needs to adopt something the Yoast SEO WP Plugin has where you can build out the title tag for certain portions. So you would have this under options for: `Pages, Posts, Topics, Authors`
just toss it in the SEO & Crawlers options

super minor - but it would be nice if each of these features auto-focused the field when used:
• Copy to portal(each step in the process)
• HubL Reference
* Basically most modals don’t do this
